arabic_text: حمٓ

translations.english_saheeh: Ḥā, Meem.[1458]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Hâ.-Mîm.
translations.english_rwwad: Hā Mīm.

arabic_text: وَٱلۡكِتَٰبِ ٱلۡمُبِينِ

translations.english_saheeh: By the clear Book,
translations.english_hilali_khan: By the manifest Book (this Qur’ân) that makes things clear.
translations.english_rwwad: By the clear Book.

arabic_text: إِنَّآ أَنزَلۡنَٰهُ فِي لَيۡلَةٖ مُّبَٰرَكَةٍۚ إِنَّا كُنَّا مُنذِرِينَ

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1459]- The Night of Decree (Qadr).  See sūrah 97.

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, We sent it down during a blessed night.[1459] Indeed, We were to warn [mankind].
translations.english_hilali_khan: in the month of Ramadân - the 9th month of the Islâmic calendar]. Verily, We are ever warning [mankind that Our Torment will reach those who disbelieve in Our Oneness of Lordship and in Our Oneness of worship].
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, We sent it down on a blessed night, for We give warning.

arabic_text: فِيهَا يُفۡرَقُ كُلُّ أَمۡرٍ حَكِيمٍ

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1460]- Or "is separated" or "apportioned," from what is inscribed in the Preserved Slate.  The angels record and descend with whatever Allāh has decreed for the coming year.
footnotes.english_hilali_khan: (V.44:4) i.e. the matters of deaths, births, provisions, calamities, etc. for the whole (coming) year as decreed by Allah.

translations.english_saheeh: Therein [i.e., on that night] is made distinct[1460] every precise matter -
translations.english_hilali_khan: Therein (that night) is decreed every matter of ordainments.[1]
translations.english_rwwad: On that night, every matter of wisdom is determined

arabic_text: أَمۡرٗا مِّنۡ عِندِنَآۚ إِنَّا كُنَّا مُرۡسِلِينَ

translations.english_saheeh: [Every] matter [proceeding] from Us. Indeed, We were to send [a messenger]
translations.english_hilali_khan: As a Command (or this Qur’ân or the Decree of every matter) from Us. Verily, We are ever sending (the Messengers),
translations.english_rwwad: by Our command. We have always sent messengers.

arabic_text: رَحۡمَةٗ مِّن رَّبِّكَۚ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلسَّمِيعُ ٱلۡعَلِيمُ
phonetic: 44.6 Raĥmatan Min Rabbika 'Innahu Huwa As-Samī`u Al-`Alīmu

translations.english_saheeh: As mercy from your Lord. Indeed, He is the Hearing, the Knowing,
translations.english_hilali_khan: (As) a Mercy from your Lord. Verily, He is the All-Hearer, the All-Knower.
translations.english_rwwad: as a mercy from your Lord. He is indeed the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing,

arabic_text: رَبِّ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَمَا بَيۡنَهُمَآۖ إِن كُنتُم مُّوقِنِينَ
phonetic: 44.7 Rabbi As-Samāwāti Wa Al-'Arđi Wa Mā Baynahumā 'In Kuntum Mūqinīna

translations.english_saheeh: Lord of the heavens and the earth and that between them, if you would be certain.
translations.english_hilali_khan: The Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, if you (but) have a faith with certainty.
translations.english_rwwad: Lord of the heavens and earth and all that is between them, if only you had sure faith.

arabic_text: لَآ إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ يُحۡيِۦ وَيُمِيتُۖ رَبُّكُمۡ وَرَبُّ ءَابَآئِكُمُ ٱلۡأَوَّلِينَ
phonetic: 44.8 Lā 'Ilāha 'Illā Huwa Yuĥyī Wa Yumītu Rabbukum Wa Rabbu 'Ābā'ikumu Al-'Awwalīna

translations.english_saheeh: There is no deity except Him; He gives life and causes death. [He is] your Lord and the Lord of your first forefathers.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Lâ ilaha illâ Huwa (none has the right to be worshipped but He). It is He Who gives life and causes death - your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers.
translations.english_rwwad: None has the right to be worshiped except Him, Who gives life and causes death – your Lord, and the Lord of your forefathers.

arabic_text: بَلۡ هُمۡ فِي شَكّٖ يَلۡعَبُونَ

translations.english_saheeh: But they are in doubt, amusing themselves.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Nay! They play about in doubt.
translations.english_rwwad: But they are in doubt, amusing themselves.

arabic_text: فَٱرۡتَقِبۡ يَوۡمَ تَأۡتِي ٱلسَّمَآءُ بِدُخَانٖ مُّبِينٖ
phonetic: 44.10 Fārtaqib Yawma Ta'tī As-Samā'u Bidukhānin Mubīnin

translations.english_saheeh: Then watch for the Day when the sky will bring a visible smoke
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then wait you for the Day when the sky will bring forth a visible smoke,
translations.english_rwwad: So wait for a day when the sky will bring forth a visible smoke,

arabic_text: يَغۡشَى ٱلنَّاسَۖ هَٰذَا عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٞ

translations.english_saheeh: Covering the people; this is a painful torment.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Covering the people: this is a painful torment.
translations.english_rwwad: that will overwhelm the people. This is a painful punishment!

arabic_text: رَّبَّنَا ٱكۡشِفۡ عَنَّا ٱلۡعَذَابَ إِنَّا مُؤۡمِنُونَ

translations.english_saheeh: [They will say], "Our Lord, remove from us the torment; indeed, we are believers."
translations.english_hilali_khan: (They will say): "Our Lord! Remove the torment from us, really we shall become believers!"
translations.english_rwwad: [They will cry,] “Our Lord, remove the punishment from us; we will surely believe!”

arabic_text: أَنَّىٰ لَهُمُ ٱلذِّكۡرَىٰ وَقَدۡ جَآءَهُمۡ رَسُولٞ مُّبِينٞ
phonetic: 44.13 'Anná Lahumu Adh-Dhikrá Wa Qad Jā'ahum Rasūlun Mubīnun

translations.english_saheeh: How will there be for them a reminder [at that time]? And there had come to them a clear Messenger.
translations.english_hilali_khan: How can there be for them an admonition (at the time when the torment has reached them), when a Messenger explaining things clearly has already come to them.
translations.english_rwwad: How will they take heed, when a messenger who explained things clearly has already come to them?

arabic_text: ثُمَّ تَوَلَّوۡاْ عَنۡهُ وَقَالُواْ مُعَلَّمٞ مَّجۡنُونٌ
phonetic: 44.14 Thumma Tawallaw `Anhu Wa Qālū Mu`allamun Majnūnun

translations.english_saheeh: Then they turned away from him and said, "[He was] taught [and is] a madman."
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then they had turned away from him (Messenger Muhammad صلى الله عليه و سلم) and said: (He is) one taught (by a human being), a madman!"
translations.english_rwwad: Then they turned away from him and said, “[He is] a madman, taught by others.”

arabic_text: إِنَّا كَاشِفُواْ ٱلۡعَذَابِ قَلِيلًاۚ إِنَّكُمۡ عَآئِدُونَ

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, We will remove the torment for a little. Indeed, you [disbelievers] will return [to disbelief].
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, We shall remove the torment for a while. Verily you will revert (to disbelief).
translations.english_rwwad: We shall hold the punishment back for a while, but you will surely return [to disbelief].

arabic_text: يَوۡمَ نَبۡطِشُ ٱلۡبَطۡشَةَ ٱلۡكُبۡرَىٰٓ إِنَّا مُنتَقِمُونَ

translations.english_saheeh: The Day We will strike with the greatest assault, indeed, We will take retribution.
translations.english_hilali_khan: On the Day when We shall seize you with the greatest seizure (punishment). Verily, We will exact retribution.
translations.english_rwwad: On the Day when We seize [them] with the greatest assault, We will surely exact retribution.

arabic_text: ۞ وَلَقَدۡ فَتَنَّا قَبۡلَهُمۡ قَوۡمَ فِرۡعَوۡنَ وَجَآءَهُمۡ رَسُولٞ كَرِيمٌ
phonetic: 44.17 Wa Laqad Fatannā Qablahum Qawma Fir`awna Wa Jā'ahum Rasūlun Karīmun

translations.english_saheeh: And We had already tried before them the people of Pharaoh, and there came to them a noble messenger [i.e., Moses],
translations.english_hilali_khan: And indeed We tried before them Fir‘aun’s (Pharaoh) people, when there came to them a noble Messenger [i.e. Mûsâ (Moses) عليه السلام],
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, We tested the people of Pharaoh before them, when a noble messenger came to them,

arabic_text: أَنۡ أَدُّوٓاْ إِلَيَّ عِبَادَ ٱللَّهِۖ إِنِّي لَكُمۡ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٞ

translations.english_saheeh: [Saying], "Render to me the servants of Allāh.[1461] Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger,"
translations.english_hilali_khan: Saying: "Deliver to me the slaves of Allâh (i.e. the Children of Israel). Verily, I am to you a Messenger worthy of all trust.
translations.english_rwwad: [saying], “Hand over to me the slaves of Allah. I am indeed a trustworthy messenger to you,

arabic_text: وَأَن لَّا تَعۡلُواْ عَلَى ٱللَّهِۖ إِنِّيٓ ءَاتِيكُم بِسُلۡطَٰنٖ مُّبِينٖ
phonetic: 44.19 Wa 'An Lā Ta`lū `Alá Allāhi 'Innī 'Ātīkum Bisulţānin Mubīnin

translations.english_saheeh: And [saying], "Be not haughty with Allāh. Indeed, I have come to you with clear evidence.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And exalt not yourselves against Allâh. Truly, I have come to you with a manifest authority.
translations.english_rwwad: and do not be arrogant towards Allah. I have certainly come to you with a clear proof.

arabic_text: وَإِنِّي عُذۡتُ بِرَبِّي وَرَبِّكُمۡ أَن تَرۡجُمُونِ

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1462]- To death.  Or "lest you assault me [with your tongues or harm me otherwise]."

translations.english_saheeh: And indeed, I have sought refuge in my Lord and your Lord, lest you stone me.[1462]
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And truly, I seek refuge with my Lord and your Lord, lest you should stone me (or call me a sorcerer or kill me).
translations.english_rwwad: And I certainly seek refuge with my Lord and your Lord, lest you stone me to death.

arabic_text: وَإِن لَّمۡ تُؤۡمِنُواْ لِي فَٱعۡتَزِلُونِ

translations.english_saheeh: But if you do not believe me, then leave me alone."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "But if you believe me not, then keep away from me and leave me alone."
translations.english_rwwad: If you do not believe me, then leave me alone.”

arabic_text: فَدَعَا رَبَّهُۥٓ أَنَّ هَٰٓؤُلَآءِ قَوۡمٞ مُّجۡرِمُونَ

translations.english_saheeh: And [finally] he called to his Lord that these were a criminal people.
translations.english_hilali_khan: (But they were aggressive), so he [Mûsâ (Moses)] called upon his Lord (saying): "These are indeed the people who are Mujrimûn (disbelievers, polytheists, sinners, criminals)."
translations.english_rwwad: Then he called upon his Lord, “These are a wicked people”.

arabic_text: فَأَسۡرِ بِعِبَادِي لَيۡلًا إِنَّكُم مُّتَّبَعُونَ

translations.english_saheeh: [Allāh said], "Then set out with My servants by night. Indeed, you are to be pursued.
translations.english_hilali_khan: (Allâh said): "Depart you with My slaves by night. Surely, you will be pursued.
translations.english_rwwad: [Allah said], “Leave along with My slaves by night; you will surely be pursued.

arabic_text: وَٱتۡرُكِ ٱلۡبَحۡرَ رَهۡوًاۖ إِنَّهُمۡ جُندٞ مُّغۡرَقُونَ
phonetic: 44.24 Wa Atruki Al-Baĥra Rahwan 'Innahum Jundun Mughraqūna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1463]- After it has parted, in order that the soldiers of Pharaoh would follow the Children of Israel and be drowned.

translations.english_saheeh: And leave the sea in stillness.[1463] Indeed, they are an army to be drowned."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And leave the sea as it is (quiet and divided). Verily, they are a host to be drowned."
translations.english_rwwad: And leave the sea parted; for they are surely an army destined to drown.”

arabic_text: كَمۡ تَرَكُواْ مِن جَنَّٰتٖ وَعُيُونٖ

translations.english_saheeh: How much they left behind of gardens and springs
translations.english_hilali_khan: How many of gardens and springs that they [Fir‘aun’s (Pharaoh) people] left behind,
translations.english_rwwad: [Imagine] how many gardens and springs they left behind,

arabic_text: وَزُرُوعٖ وَمَقَامٖ كَرِيمٖ

translations.english_saheeh: And crops and noble sites
translations.english_hilali_khan: And green crops (fields) and goodly places,
translations.english_rwwad: and crops and splendid mansions,

arabic_text: وَنَعۡمَةٖ كَانُواْ فِيهَا فَٰكِهِينَ

translations.english_saheeh: And comfort wherein they were amused.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And comforts of life wherein they used to take delight!
translations.english_rwwad: and luxuries they used to rejoice therein.

arabic_text: كَذَٰلِكَۖ وَأَوۡرَثۡنَٰهَا قَوۡمًا ءَاخَرِينَ

translations.english_saheeh: Thus. And We caused to inherit it another people.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Thus (it was)! And We made other people inherit them (i.e. We made the Children of Israel to inherit the kingdom of Egypt).
translations.english_rwwad: So it was; and We made another people inherit all that.

arabic_text: فَمَا بَكَتۡ عَلَيۡهِمُ ٱلسَّمَآءُ وَٱلۡأَرۡضُ وَمَا كَانُواْ مُنظَرِينَ
phonetic: 44.29 Famā Bakat `Alayhimu As-Samā'u Wa Al-'Arđu Wa Mā Kānū Munžarīna

footnotes.english_hilali_khan: (V.44:29) Narrated Ibn Jarîr At-Tabari: Ibn ‘Abbâs رضي الله عنهما said, "When a believer dies, the place of earth on which he used to prostrate himself in his Salât (prayer), and the gate in the heaven through which his good deeds used to ascend, weep for him (or her), while they do not weep for the disbeliever." [Tafsir At-Tabari].

translations.english_saheeh: And the heaven and earth wept not for them, nor were they reprieved.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And the heavens and the earth wept not for them,[1] nor were they given a respite.
translations.english_rwwad: Neither the heaven nor earth wept for them, nor were they given any respite.

arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ نَجَّيۡنَا بَنِيٓ إِسۡرَٰٓءِيلَ مِنَ ٱلۡعَذَابِ ٱلۡمُهِينِ
phonetic: 44.30 Wa Laqad Najjaynā Banī 'Isrā'īla Mina Al-`Adhābi Al-Muhīni

translations.english_saheeh: And We certainly saved the Children of Israel from the humiliating torment -
translations.english_hilali_khan: And indeed We saved the Children of Israel from the humiliating torment:
translations.english_rwwad: Thus did We save the Children of Israel from the humiliating punishment,

arabic_text: مِن فِرۡعَوۡنَۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ عَالِيٗا مِّنَ ٱلۡمُسۡرِفِينَ

translations.english_saheeh: From Pharaoh. Indeed, he was a haughty one among the transgressors.
translations.english_hilali_khan: From Fir‘aun (Pharaoh); verily he was arrogant and was of the Musrifûn (those who transgress beyond bound in spending and other things and commit great sins).
translations.english_rwwad: from Pharaoh. He was indeed arrogant who transgressed all bounds.

arabic_text: وَلَقَدِ ٱخۡتَرۡنَٰهُمۡ عَلَىٰ عِلۡمٍ عَلَى ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ

translations.english_saheeh: And We certainly chose them by knowledge over [all] the worlds.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We chose them (the Children of Israel) above the ‘Âlamîn (mankind and jinn) [during the time of Mûsâ (Moses)] with knowledge,
translations.english_rwwad: We chose them with knowledge above all others.

arabic_text: وَءَاتَيۡنَٰهُم مِّنَ ٱلۡأٓيَٰتِ مَا فِيهِ بَلَٰٓؤٞاْ مُّبِينٌ
phonetic: 44.33 Wa 'Ātaynāhum Mina Al-'Āyāti Mā Fīhi Balā'un Mubīnun

translations.english_saheeh: And We gave them of signs that in which there was a clear trial.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And granted them signs in which there was a plain trial.
translations.english_rwwad: And We gave them signs in which there was a clear test.

arabic_text: إِنَّ هَٰٓؤُلَآءِ لَيَقُولُونَ

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, these [disbelievers] are saying,
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, these (Quraish) people are saying:
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, these [Makkans] say,

arabic_text: إِنۡ هِيَ إِلَّا مَوۡتَتُنَا ٱلۡأُولَىٰ وَمَا نَحۡنُ بِمُنشَرِينَ
phonetic: 44.35 'In Hiya 'Illā Mawtatunā Al-'Ūlá Wa Mā Naĥnu Bimunsharīna

translations.english_saheeh: "There is not but our first death, and we will not be resurrected.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "There is nothing but our first death, and we shall not be resurrected.
translations.english_rwwad: “There is nothing after our first death, and we will not be resurrected,

arabic_text: فَأۡتُواْ بِـَٔابَآئِنَآ إِن كُنتُمۡ صَٰدِقِينَ

translations.english_saheeh: Then bring [back] our forefathers, if you should be truthful."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Then bring back our forefathers, if you speak the truth!"
translations.english_rwwad: then bring back our forefathers if you are truthful.”

arabic_text: أَهُمۡ خَيۡرٌ أَمۡ قَوۡمُ تُبَّعٖ وَٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبۡلِهِمۡ أَهۡلَكۡنَٰهُمۡۚ إِنَّهُمۡ كَانُواْ مُجۡرِمِينَ
phonetic: 44.37 'Ahum Khayrun 'Am Qawmu Tubba`in Wa Al-Ladhīna Min Qablihim 'Ahlaknāhum 'Innahum Kānū Mujrimīna

translations.english_saheeh: Are they better or the people of Tubbaʿ[1464] and those before them? We destroyed them, [for] indeed, they were criminals.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Are they better or the people of Tubba‘ and those before them? We destroyed them because they were indeed Mujrimûn (disbelievers, polytheists, sinners, criminals).
translations.english_rwwad: Are they better [in power] or the people of Tubba‘ and those who were before them? We destroyed them, for they were truly wicked.

arabic_text: وَمَا خَلَقۡنَا ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضَ وَمَا بَيۡنَهُمَا لَٰعِبِينَ
phonetic: 44.38 Wa Mā Khalaqnā As-Samāwāti Wa Al-'Arđa Wa Mā Baynahumā Lā`ibīna

translations.english_saheeh: And We did not create the heavens and earth and that between them in play.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We created not the heavens and the earth, and all that is between them, for mere play.
translations.english_rwwad: We have not created the heavens and earth and all that is between them for amusement.

arabic_text: مَا خَلَقۡنَٰهُمَآ إِلَّا بِٱلۡحَقِّ وَلَٰكِنَّ أَكۡثَرَهُمۡ لَا يَعۡلَمُونَ
phonetic: 44.39 Mā Khalaqnāhumā 'Illā Bil-Ĥaqqi Wa Lakinna 'Aktharahum Lā Ya`lamūna

translations.english_saheeh: We did not create them except in truth, but most of them do not know.
translations.english_hilali_khan: We created them not except with truth (i.e. to examine and test those who are obedient and those who are disobedient and then reward the obedient ones and punish the disobedient ones), but most of them know not.
translations.english_rwwad: We have not created them except for a true purpose, but most of them do not know.

arabic_text: إِنَّ يَوۡمَ ٱلۡفَصۡلِ مِيقَٰتُهُمۡ أَجۡمَعِينَ

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, the Day of Judgement is the appointed time for them all -
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, the Day of Judgement (when Allâh will judge between the creatures) is the time appointed for all of them -
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, the Day of Judgment is the time appointed for them all,

arabic_text: يَوۡمَ لَا يُغۡنِي مَوۡلًى عَن مَّوۡلٗى شَيۡـٔٗا وَلَا هُمۡ يُنصَرُونَ
phonetic: 44.41 Yawma Lā Yughnī Mawláan `An Mawláan Shay'āan Wa Lā Hum Yunşarūna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1465]- i.e., patron, protector or close associate.

translations.english_saheeh: The Day when no relation[1465] will avail a relation at all, nor will they be helped -
translations.english_hilali_khan: The Day when a Maulâ (a near relative) cannot avail a Maulâ (a near relative) in aught, and no help can they receive,
translations.english_rwwad: the Day when no friend will avail another in the least, nor will they be helped,

arabic_text: إِلَّا مَن رَّحِمَ ٱللَّهُۚ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلۡعَزِيزُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
phonetic: 44.42 'Illā Man Raĥima Allāhu 'Innahu Huwa Al-`Azīzu Ar-Raĥīmu

translations.english_saheeh: Except those [believers] on whom Allāh has mercy. Indeed, He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Except him on whom Allâh has Mercy. Verily, He is the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.
translations.english_rwwad: except those to whom Allah shows mercy. He is indeed the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.

arabic_text: إِنَّ شَجَرَتَ ٱلزَّقُّومِ

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, the tree of zaqqūm
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, the tree of Zaqqûm
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, the tree of Zaqqūm

arabic_text: طَعَامُ ٱلۡأَثِيمِ

translations.english_saheeh: Is food for the sinful.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Will be the food of the sinners.
translations.english_rwwad: will be the food of the sinful,

arabic_text: كَٱلۡمُهۡلِ يَغۡلِي فِي ٱلۡبُطُونِ

translations.english_saheeh: Like murky oil, it boils within bellies
translations.english_hilali_khan: Like boiling oil, it will boil in the bellies,
translations.english_rwwad: like molten metal that will boil in their bellies

arabic_text: كَغَلۡيِ ٱلۡحَمِيمِ

translations.english_saheeh: Like the boiling of scalding water.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Like the boiling of scalding water.
translations.english_rwwad: like the boiling of scalding water.

arabic_text: خُذُوهُ فَٱعۡتِلُوهُ إِلَىٰ سَوَآءِ ٱلۡجَحِيمِ

translations.english_saheeh: [It will be commanded], "Seize him and drag him into the midst of the Hellfire,
translations.english_hilali_khan: (It will be said) "Seize him and drag him into the midst of blazing Fire,
translations.english_rwwad: [It will be said], “Seize him and drag him into the midst of the Blazing Fire.

arabic_text: ثُمَّ صُبُّواْ فَوۡقَ رَأۡسِهِۦ مِنۡ عَذَابِ ٱلۡحَمِيمِ
phonetic: 44.48 Thumma Şubbū Fawqa Ra'sihi Min `Adhābi Al-Ĥamīmi

translations.english_saheeh: Then pour over his head from the torment of scalding water."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Then pour over his head the torment of boiling water.
translations.english_rwwad: Then pour over his head the torment of scalding water.”

arabic_text: ذُقۡ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ ٱلۡعَزِيزُ ٱلۡكَرِيمُ

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1466]- As he had claimed upon the earth.  He is taunted with these words in Hell as a reminder and additional torment.

translations.english_saheeh: [It will be said], "Taste! Indeed, you are the honored, the noble![1466]
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Taste you (this)! Verily, you were (pretending to be) the mighty, the generous!
translations.english_rwwad: “Taste this. You are surely the mighty and honorable!

arabic_text: إِنَّ هَٰذَا مَا كُنتُم بِهِۦ تَمۡتَرُونَ

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, this is what you used to dispute."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Verily, this is that whereof you used to doubt!"
translations.english_rwwad: This is what you [all] used to doubt.”

arabic_text: إِنَّ ٱلۡمُتَّقِينَ فِي مَقَامٍ أَمِينٖ

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, the righteous will be in a secure place:
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, the Muttaqûn (the pious. See V.2:2), will be in place of Security (Paradise).
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, the righteous will be in a safe place,

arabic_text: فِي جَنَّٰتٖ وَعُيُونٖ

translations.english_saheeh: Within gardens and springs,
translations.english_hilali_khan: Among Gardens and Springs,
translations.english_rwwad: in gardens and springs,

arabic_text: يَلۡبَسُونَ مِن سُندُسٖ وَإِسۡتَبۡرَقٖ مُّتَقَٰبِلِينَ

translations.english_saheeh: Wearing [garments of] fine silk and brocade, facing each other.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Dressed in fine silk and (also) in thick silk, facing each other,
translations.english_rwwad: wearing fine silk and heavy brocade, facing one another.

arabic_text: كَذَٰلِكَ وَزَوَّجۡنَٰهُم بِحُورٍ عِينٖ

footnotes.english_hilali_khan: (V.44:54) Hûr: Very fair females created by Allah as such, not from the offspring of Adam عليه السلام, with intense black irises of their eyes and intense white scleras. [For details see the book Hadi Al-Arwâh by Ibn Al-Qaiyim, Chapter 54, Page 147].

translations.english_saheeh: Thus. And We will marry them to fair women with large, [beautiful] eyes.
translations.english_hilali_khan: So (it will be). And We shall marry them to Hûr[1] (fair female) with wide, lovely eyes.
translations.english_rwwad: So it will be, and We will marry them to maidens with gorgeous eyes.

arabic_text: يَدۡعُونَ فِيهَا بِكُلِّ فَٰكِهَةٍ ءَامِنِينَ

translations.english_saheeh: They will call therein for every [kind of] fruit - safe and secure.
translations.english_hilali_khan: They will call therein for every kind of fruit in peace and security;
translations.english_rwwad: They will call therein for every kind of fruit, safe and secure.

arabic_text: لَا يَذُوقُونَ فِيهَا ٱلۡمَوۡتَ إِلَّا ٱلۡمَوۡتَةَ ٱلۡأُولَىٰۖ وَوَقَىٰهُمۡ عَذَابَ ٱلۡجَحِيمِ
phonetic: 44.56 Lā Yadhūqūna Fīhā Al-Mawta 'Illā Al-Mawtata Al-'Ūlá Wa Waqāhum `Adhāba Al-Jaĥīmi

translations.english_saheeh: They will not taste death therein except the first death, and He will have protected them from the punishment of Hellfire
translations.english_hilali_khan: They will never taste death therein except the first death (of this world), and He will save them from the torment of the blazing Fire,
translations.english_rwwad: They will not taste death therein except the first death, and He will protect them from the punishment of the Blazing Fire,

arabic_text: فَضۡلٗا مِّن رَّبِّكَۚ ذَٰلِكَ هُوَ ٱلۡفَوۡزُ ٱلۡعَظِيمُ
phonetic: 44.57 Fađlāan Min Rabbika Dhālika Huwa Al-Fawzu Al-`Ažīmu

translations.english_saheeh: As bounty from your Lord. That is what is the great attainment.
translations.english_hilali_khan: As a Bounty from your Lord! That will be the supreme success!
translations.english_rwwad: as a grace from your Lord. That is the supreme triumph.

arabic_text: فَإِنَّمَا يَسَّرۡنَٰهُ بِلِسَانِكَ لَعَلَّهُمۡ يَتَذَكَّرُونَ

translations.english_saheeh: And indeed, We have eased it [i.e., the Qur’ān] in your tongue that they might be reminded.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Certainly, We have made this (Qur’an) easy in your tongue, in order that they may remember.
translations.english_rwwad: We have made this [Qur’an] easy in your own language, so that they may take heed.

arabic_text: فَٱرۡتَقِبۡ إِنَّهُم مُّرۡتَقِبُونَ

translations.english_saheeh: So watch, [O Muḥammad]; indeed, they are watching [for your end].
translations.english_hilali_khan: Wait then (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه و سلم); verily, they (too) are waiting.
translations.english_rwwad: Then wait; they too are waiting.
